docs.snippet: The author of “Future Shock” warned about the dangers of rapid change, and many have come to pass, but advance planning has fallen out of favor....
docs.lead_paragraph: The author of “Future Shock” warned about the dangers of rapid change, and many have come to pass, but advance planning has fallen out of favor.
docs.abstract: Farhad Manjoo State of the Art column says prophecy from Alvin Toffler's 1970 book Future Shock--that quickening pace of technological change will have debilitating effect similar to sickness--is largely coming true; says local and global crises appear daily from our collective inability to cope with ever-quicker change.

headline.main: Why We Need to Pick Up Alvin Toffler’s Torch
headline.print_headline: The Future Toffler Saw Is Already Upon Us
